items.title: Campaigns and Communications Recruiter
items.content:
Campaigns and Communications Recruiter at Change.org

Remote | Freelance | Part-time
  • People & Talent
  • Contractor
  • United States and Canada (San Francisco, CA, New York, NY, Washington, DC and Victoria, BC)

With almost 250 million users in 196 countries, Change.org is the world’s largest technology platform for social change. Our team spans 18 countries and empowers hundreds of millions of people make the change they want to see. We’re a social impact business, and we aim to build a world where no one is powerless and where creating change is a part of everyday life.

We care deeply about delivering an exceptional experience that gives our candidates a genuine view into Change.org and our impact. We’re committed to being a diverse and inclusive workplace, where our staff be as diverse as our user base. If you have a passion for hiring candidates of all backgrounds and making a positive impact in the world, this may be the opportunity for you.

We’re looking for a top notch contract recruiter or firm to drive an exciting and rapid expansion of our North American Campaigns Team over the next three months.

We aim to hire world’s best social change campaigners and communicators in a range or roles at all levels, and fast.

Here’s what you’ll do as a partner to our team:

  • Full-cycle recruiting (source, screen, qualify, offer, close) for at least 5 roles, and up to 9, on our North American campaigns team from entry level to executive between now and 30 November 2018.
  • Partner closely with hiring managers and their teams to deeply understand our hiring needs and create unique strategies for each.
  • Create and execute strategies for identifying and engaging active and passive candidates, and build robust and diverse pipelines of candidates through various channels.
  • Drive offer approval, extension, negotiation, and close candidates.

Here’s what we’re looking for:

  • Expertise and experience in recruiting for contemporary social change campaigning organizations, including digital first campaigners, communications campaigners and other effective activist and advocate roles.
  • Full-cycle recruiting experience, with diversity sourcing and/or recruiting experience a major plus.
  • Demonstrated ability to identify, engage, and qualify and close diverse, excellent and well-matched candidates.
  • Recruiters who are innovative, curious, empathetic and constantly looking for new ways to find top talent and reach underrepresented communities.
  • Ability to rigorously prioritize and multitask and the excitement to roll up your sleeves and contribute to the recruiting process.

Interested? Here are some more details:

  • This is a contract position for 30 hours a week over 2 months.
  • This opportunity could be based anywhere in Canada or the United States, with a strong preference for New York, Washington DC or San Francisco.

Change.org is committed to being a diverse and inclusive workplace. We encourage applicants and firms of different backgrounds, cultures, genders, experiences, abilities and perspectives to submit proposals.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, age, physical disability, or length of time spent unemployed.

Apply for job

items.content:
Faculty Talent Sourcing Specialist at Kaplan

Remote

Location: Remote/Nationwide Remote/Nationwide USA

As a Talent Sourcing Specialist, you’ll recruit new instructors for our Grad and Pre-College courses. This requires working closely with your Director and Faculty Managers to identify recruitment needs and develop and execute recruitment strategies to find qualified candidates.

Through these activities, you’ll demonstrate keen problem-solving skills, boundless creativity, and the ability to prioritize shifting needs. You’ll also be a student of Kaplan’s course structure and methodology so you can speak fluently about the benefits of a Kaplan role.

In addition to sourcing, you’ll partner with our Hiring Support Specialists to guide candidates through our interview process and you’ll communicate with candidates in a professional, compassionate manner that builds Kaplan’s reputation as an excellent employer.

Finally, you’ll be willing to fail often! Were looking for empathetic, highly intelligent candidates who can often be difficult to find. This leads to a lot of failed inquiries. Were looking for a resilient recruiter eager to embrace this challenge.

Core Responsibilities:

  • Discover qualified candidates to meet all recruitment needs in your area.
  • Meet your monthly candidate volume goals.
  • Develop relationships with internal and external stakeholders to maintain consistent pipelines of talent.
  • Evaluate and assist with improving the faculty recruitment process on an ongoing basis.

Competencies:

  • Skilled communicator – Displays polished written and verbal communication skills; can read the room and use an appropriate style/tone for a given circumstance.
  • Persuasive – Sells Kaplan as an employer of choice and build strong relationships with candidates, gatekeepers, and internal partners.
  • Tech Savvy – Learns new systems quickly; tends to learn through exploration and open to changing technologies.
  • Enthusiastic – Exhibits passion and excitement thats contagious throughout the department and organization; has a positive/constructive team-oriented attitude.
  • Proactive – acts on own accord without having to be told what to do; gets ahead of potential problems. (We also call this skill, Willing to Break Things.)
  • Well-organized – Plans, organizes, schedules, and budgets time in an efficient, productive manner; focuses efforts on key priorities.
  • Creative – Brings new ideas and solutions to solve old problems; willing to go out on a ledge to try a novel idea.
  • Intelligent – Learns quickly. Demonstrates ability to quickly and proficiently understand and absorb new information.
  • Collaborative – Recognizes that the success of an individual is founded on the success of the team; quick to accept fault for failures and assign successes to others.
  • Resilient – Willing to fail nine times in a row but happily make a stronger effort on the tenth attempt.

Basic Requirements:

  • Bachelors Degree
  • Recommendation from current supervisor (for internal candidates)
  • Recruiting experience preferred
Apply for job

items.content:
Human Resources and Recruiting Coordinator Job at ConsenSys - AngelList
  • ConsenSys
  • Product
  • Jobs
  • Team
Applied
Apply Now
Add a message to ConsenSys
Apply
Share

Human Resources and Recruiting Coordinator at ConsenSys

Brooklyn, Remote · Full Time
We're a fluid organization comprised of deep thinkers from a variety of backgrounds.Read More

We're a fluid organization comprised of deep thinkers from a variety of backgrounds.

We're passionate about our work and are looking to find others who are interested in building solutions for an emerging, digitally-integrated economy. 

Please see our website for current opportunities. https://consensys.net/open-positions/

Applied
Apply to ConsenSys
Add a message to ConsenSys
Apply

Job Description

Apply Here:

ConsenSys is a venture production studio focused on building and scaling tools and enterprise software products powered by Ethereum. Our mission is to use these solutions to power the emerging economic, social, and political operating systems of the planet.

Our teams are busy at work building the future of identity, financial markets, commerce, the music industry, security and infrastructure, and more. To accomplish this, we’ve built out a flat organizational structure which we call the ConsenSys Mesh; a network of individuals & teams working autonomously and towards the same goal. The MeshOps team is responsible for designing and implementing “Meshocracy”, our own operational & company structure loosely based on the principles of holacracy. If you are someone that thrives in a fast-paced environment where being self-directed, determined, and resilient are a requirement, we would love for you to join us.

The Role

The Human Resources and Recruiting Coordinator is an integral member of our team! We need help telling our story around the world! In this role you will develop a solid foundation of knowledge and experience as part of a greater global team serving countless internal customers and projects on 6 continents. You will have the opportunity to build candidate relationships, and partner with recruiters, human resources and hiring managers. The ideal candidate seeks career growth within Recruiting and/or Human Resources and will provide support in many different areas. This is truly a choose your own destiny situation, and a chance for ownership. This role will grow and evolve as ConsenSys grows and incolves

Build excellent relationships across our organization
Create welcome packages and kits for new hires
Coordinate interview activities on-campus and in-house including, but not limited to, scheduling and calendar invites; interview confirmation emails; reserving interview rooms and telephone/video conference (when necessary); and candidate debrief calls/meetings
Schedule and coordinate logistics for all campus recruiting events, e.g. RSVPs, payment/check requests, calendar invites, etc.
Manage inventory for all recruiting swag and ensure all swag is readily available.
Coordinate offer letter process and as well as onboarding set-up
Provide support on special projects and initiatives
Assist with the internship program and internal events
Assist with wellness endeavors
Required Skills:

Meticulous attention to detail and strong organizational skills with proven ability to prioritize and complete projects within deadlines
Self-starter who loves taking initiative
Creative problem solver
Discreet and able to manage sensitive information
Flexibility, high energy and a positive attitude
Prior experience in a Recruiting or Human Resources department is preferred
Familiarity with applicant tracking systems, HR systems and social media is preferred
Ability to focus on the details, but also understand the bigger picture
Bonus Points:

Interest in new technology, Blockchain, and/or Ethereum
Humble, kind, and doesn't take themselves too seriously

Compensation
$50K–$55K
0.01%–0.01%
Visa Sponsorship
Available
Applied
Apply Now
Add a message to ConsenSys
Apply

What We're Building

ConsenSys is a blockchain venture production studio building decentralized applications, mostly on Ethereum. We are currently building foundational tools for emerging business models in the cryptocurrency or Bitcoin 2.0 space. These tools will be packaged into separate ventures that are individually funded and skinned for different business niches.

ConsenSys is presently comprised of a number of core personnel — some of whom are based in New York City, but several are in other cities around the world — who are focussed on the identification, acquisition, and development of talent and projects, in addition to the development of our own internal projects and some focus on consulting work.

ConsenSys spawns, coordinates, incubates and accelerates single purpose vehicles (SPVs) through internal development, acquisitions, investments, or the formation of joint ventures.

Hiring in Brooklyn, Remote OK
501-1000 Employees

items.title: Unity Developer 80% REMOTE WORKING - IT Talent - Cardiff
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=39, c=6, mobile=63, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=4, java=2, gamedev=96, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Unity Developer 80% REMOTE WORKING

Company: IT Talent
Location: Cardiff
£200 - £250 a day -

Contract

Hi,

Are you interested in a large Unity contract? – 6 plus months with some flexible working?

We need a contract Unity 3D Developer to join our client in Cardiff (remote working as long as you can attend site 2 days per week). You will have experience of working with C# in Unity, developing virtual reality, Augmented & 360 ̊ content for delivery across multiple platforms.

Key Skills/Experience Required:

  • Unity, C#, Mobile Experience
  • 3 years' commercial experience developing apps, games and video components in Unity.
  • Knowledge of programming concepts
  • design/programming best practices
  • design patterns within mobile games.
  • An understanding of both iOS and Android platforms.
  • Web services and a good understanding of web technologies.

Other Desirable skills:

  • Unreal Engine 4
  • Prior experience in development of Website, Desktop & / OR Mobile.

Please send CV for immediate consideration.

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

UNITY C# .NET GAMES GAME GAMING DEVELOPER UNITY UNITY3D 3D .NET UNREAL VR AR MR MOBILE APP ANDROID IOS UNITY .NET

Job Type: Contract

Salary: £200.00 to £250.00 /day

items.title: SEEKING FREELANCER Worldwide, REMOTE, near-total flexibility on hours. $70-100/hr. Expert Interviewer at Karat  ...
items.content:
SEEKING FREELANCER

Worldwide, REMOTE, near-total flexibility on hours. $70-100/hr. Expert Interviewer at Karat (https://karat.io)

Work from anywhere in the world that has a solid internet connection. Work as much or as little as you want. Work any day, any time of day, any number of hours -- you can do 0 one week, 50 the next week, and back to 0 the next week. Only requirement there is that we want you to roughly average at least 10 hours a week, or else the training/time investment doesn't make as much sense from your end or ours.

I know the above might sound a little strange, so a bit about the company for context: Karat is a Seattle-based startup that does software engineering interviews on behalf of other companies -- primarily first-round phone screens. Quickly-growing companies can spend a significant fraction of their engineers' time interviewing; we help take the load off. We've done a lot to make the interview experience better for all stakeholders that I could write whole essays about, but suffice it to say that candidates love working with us, clients love working with us, and we're well-funded and growing quickly as a result.

Because of this quickly-growing demand, we're looking to hire more Expert Interviewers. The ideal candidate is a software engineer with strong written and verbal English skills with at least a few years of professional experience. Interviewing experience would be great, but we spend 25 hours (paid) training you before you even start, so if you're strong technically and love working with people we can usually make it work :) Interviews are conducted over video chat, using a collaborative code editor.

Some of our interviewers are freelancers who use our scheduling model to backfill hours; others are full timers at top tech companies looking to make some extra cash; others have quit their jobs to work with us full time; some are digital nomads; one of our interviewers is road tripping around North America for a year and a half, doing anywhere from zero to 40 interviews each week depending on where he is and what the weather's like.

The application form is here: https://jobs.lever.co/karat/d44ab283-c7c0-4bbd-b8c3-4dc0ced6...

I know it's a pretty unique job, so if you have any questions reply here or email me at josh@karat.io and I'm happy to talk through any of it.
